intro: Cheiradenia cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed cheiradenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to white. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and rocky slopes. Cheiradenia cuspidata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
